JobFullDesc: This is a high-visibility role as the Finance Manager for the MLS organization within the Surveillance and Targeting Systems (STS) Product Line.  The MLS product line is comprised of a number of production programs and is the financial driver within STS.   The position is an integral part of both the Finance and Program Leadership Teams helping to build strategy, creating a management operating system to maximize organizational performance, developing organizational capability, and meeting customer & shareholder commitments.  Excellent communication skills required to satisfy financial deliverables and provide key actionable information.   Primary responsibilities include, but are not limited to:  Preparation of Five Year and Annual Operating Plans, financial forecasting and reporting, variance analysis, Earned Value Management and compliance, Estimates at Completion (EACs), proposal support, cash management, capital/company funded requests, ROI analysis, audit/policy compliance and ah-hoc financial status reviews with leadership. A key requirement for this position is the ability to provide strategic financial leadership for the program including areas such as affordability, cost management, and program growth.  An in-depth working knowledge of Earned Value Management System (EVMS) concepts, procedures and processes, including baseline planning and Program Management execution is also required.  Interested candidates must have prior Finance Management experience along with a proficiency in Finance reporting systems and processes. The successful candidate will have the ability to work independently, be self-motivated, and comfortable with new challenges and multiple competing priorities.  Strong communication skills are also required, along with the ability to effectively interact with multiple layers within the organization and to make recommendations for appropriate solutions. Additional activities include, but are not limited to: Developing cost strategy, forming proposal cost team, supporting cost volume activities, compiling cost, schedule, and technical elements in the development of proposals in accordance with request for proposal (RFP) specifications, coordinating the collection and accumulation of cost, scheduling, and performance elements from functional departments, researching and analyzing historical data, developing cost models to supporting proposal efforts, coordinating activities and participating in fact-finding meetings, participating in should-cost and pricing reviews with management and customer representatives and participating as a member of the contract negotiating team. *Required Skills:  10+ years of Finance or related experience Experience interfacing and conducting business with various functional disciplines (Contracts, Operations, Engineering, etc) in proposal development and program execution.Excellent communication skills (written and oral) to support the preparation and presentation of written briefs and summaries for internal/external dissemination Experience analyzing data and information necessary to ensure program performance to plan and to ensure that problem areas are identified and corrective action is taken  Ability to manage multiple priorities and influence in a matrix organizationProficient computer software skills in MS Office - Excel, PowerPoint and Word Desired Skills:   Working knowledge of SAP, APEX EV, Business WarehouseKnowledge of Earned Value Management System (EVMS) & Experience with and knowledge of APEX EV Bid/Cost Proposal leadership experience working on proposals in excess of $500 MillionGovCon/Defense industry experience with knowledge of both government accounting techniques and Sarbanes-Oxley compliance processes; domestically and internationallyExperience in preparing and reviewing Estimates at Completion (EACs) Experience in development / strategic program new business capture.Experience in Financial Planning and AnalysisExperience in competitive proposal developmentExperience with new contract set-up & Business Process Management  *Required Education:   Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, or related discipline. This position requires either a U.S. Person or a Non-U.S. Person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization.
